power.title: Agile Recovery
power.fluff: With a quick leap, you are back on your feet and ready to act

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You stand up from prone.

power.title: Graceful Maneuver
power.fluff: You dodge past your enemies with speed and grace

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You shift up to half your speed.

power.title: Quick Balance
power.fluff: You keep your balance with practiced ease

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You move your speed. During this movement, you do not need to spend additional squares of movement while you are balancing.

power.title: Arcane Mutterings
power.fluff: You launch into a recitation of obscure lore on a subject to impress, cow, or trick your audience

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You would make a Bluff check or an Intimidate check

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use your Arcana skill check modifier in place of the triggering skill's check modifier.

power.title: Arcane Senses
power.fluff: You refocus your eyes to see magic energy invisible to the untrained eye, learning how many magical creatures are nearby

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Choose one of the following two effects when you use this power:
For each creature you currently see, you learn whether that creature has the elemental, fey, or shadow origin.

You learn the number of elemental, fey, and shadow creatures within a number of squares of you equal to 5 + your Arcana skill check modifier. You don't learn the creatures' locations, but you do learn separate counts for each origin and whether there are solo creatures of that type present.

power.title: Studied Ritualist
power.fluff: You catch an error at the last moment, correcting a malformed glyph before it can ruin your ritual

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make a skill check to perform a ritual and dislike the result

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You reroll the triggering check with a +2 power bonus to the roll. You must use the second roll.

power.title: Bounding Leap
power.fluff: As you spring through the air, you tuck in your legs and arms, spinning to eke out a little extra distance

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make an Athletics check to jump

section.name: Effect:
section.text: If you did not have a running start for the jump, you are considered to have a running start.
If you had a running start, you gain a +5 power bonus to the check and the distance you jump can exceed your speed by 1 square.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: By 2 squares.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: By 3 squares.

power.title: Mounted Coordination
power.fluff: You synchronize your attack with your mount's movements to maximize your damage

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be mounted on a willing creature

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain a +2 bonus to the first damage roll you make before the start of your next turn. You lose this bonus if you are no longer mounted.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: +4 bonus.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: +6 bonus.

power.title: Scrambling Climb
power.fluff: You use your forward momentum to help pull yourself upward

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You move at least two squares to a surface you can climb.
You then make an Athletics check to climb, and choose one of the following benefits:
► A +5 power bonus to the check.
► Squares your climb do not count as one additional squares of movement until the end of your current turn.

power.title: Battle Feint
power.fluff: Your sudden move causes the enemy to flinch, settung up your ally's next attack

section.name: Check:
section.text: Bluff vs. Passive Insight

section.name: Success:
section.text: One ally adjacent to you gains combat advantage against the target for the ally's first attack against it before the end of your next turn.

power.title: False Bravado
power.fluff: Your apparent courage makes your enemy think twice about pressing its attack

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be marked.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You are no longer marked.

power.title: Serpent's Tongue
power.fluff: Your lie twists in your foe's mind like a snake, allowing you to hide the venom behind your next words

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You fail a Bluff check against a single creature

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain a +4 power bonus to the next Bluff or Intimidate check you make against the triggering creature, or a +2 power bonus to the next Diplomacy check you make against it.

power.title: Good Guard
power.fluff: You know how to use honeyed words to play into your ally's intimidation

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must use this power as part of an interaction where you and an ally are trying to gain information from a creature that shares a language with you.

section.name: Target:
section.text: An ally in the burst making an Intimidate check

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You automatically succeed in aiding the target's skill check, and grant the target an additional +2 power bonus to the check.

power.title: Master Diplomat
power.fluff: Catching a possible faux pas in what you were about to say, you quickly adjust your soothing words and flattery to work more magic than the most powerful spell

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make a Diplomacy check and dislike the result
You decide whether to use this power before the DM announces the result of your roll

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You reroll the triggering check, and use whichever result you prefer.

power.title: Soothing Words
power.fluff: The battle done, your allies turn to you for support

section.name: Target:
section.text: Each ally who interacts with you during the rest

section.name: Effect:
section.text: For each healing surge the targets spend at the end of the rest, they regain 2 additional hit points.

section.name: Level 6:
section.text: 3 additional hit points.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: 4 additional hit points.

section.name: Level 16:
section.text: 5 additional hit points.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: 6 additional hit points.

section.name: Level 26:
section.text: 7 additional hit points.

power.title: Cave Sense
power.fluff: You close your eyes, focusing on the sounds and the air flow to give you a rough mental picture of the cavern ahead

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You learn the general layout of terrain features in the burst.
You cannot sense through solid objects, such as cave walls, but you do sense around corners and into narrow gaps.
Additionally, you can make Perception checks to detect hidden creatures, objects, and traps in the burst as though you were within 10 squares of them.

power.title: Deep Shadows
power.fluff: Judging the play of shadows against the cave wall, you spot a hiding place that an untrained explorer would overlook

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be underground, and have cover or concealment

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You make a Stealth check to hide, using your Dungeoneering check modifier in place of your Stealth check modifier for the check.

power.title: Otherworldly Lore
power.fluff: Something about the aberrant horror's movement strikes a chord - you know just where to strike it

section.name: Target:
section.target: one aberrant creature you can see

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You make a Dungeoneering monster knowledge check to determine the target's resistances, vulnerabilities and other weaknesses.

If the check succeeds, you or one ally who can hear you gains a +2 power bonus to his or her first attack roll against the target. The power bonus increases to +4 if the attack trigger's the target's vulnerability or weakness. The attack must come before the end of your next turn.

power.title: Stay Back
power.fluff: You sweep your torch or lantern around you to dazzle enemies accustomed to darkness

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be carrying a light source.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, your light source distracts your enemies.
Enemies in squares illuminated one level (from dimly lit to brightly lit, or darkness to dimly lit) take a -1 penalty to attack rolls and Perception checks.

Enemies in squares illuminated two levels (from darkness to brightly lit) take a -2 penalty to attack rolls and Perception checks. Your DM can decide that certain creatures not accustomed to light take this penalty when in squares illuminated only one level.

power.title: Endure Pain
power.fluff: You grin and bear it, shrugging off the pain of a new wound

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You are hit by an attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain resist all against the triggering attack. The resist equals one-half the number of healing surges you have remaining.

power.title: Exemplar of Valor
power.fluff: You brace yourself against the terror inspired by a foe, and your bravery serves as an example to your friends

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You are the target of a Fear effect

section.name: Target:
section.target: you and each ally in the burst that can see you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of the encounter, each target gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses against Fear effects.

If the triggering attack hits you, you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls against the triggering enemy until the end of your next turn. If the triggering attack misses you, target allies gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls against the triggering enemy until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Grit and Spittle
power.fluff: Drawing on pure stubberness, you're ready to see your way through disaster

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must have at least 1 healing surge remaining

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You spend a healing surge to make a saving throw against every effect on you that a save can end.
For each saving throw that fails, you regain hit points equal to one-half your level (minimum 1).

power.title: Inspiring Fortitude
power.fluff: Inspired by your resilience, your allies find the will to overcome challenges

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: Your must have your second wind available.

section.name: Target:
section.target: you, and each ally in the burst

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use your second wind.
Each target ally gains temporary hit points equal to 4 + your Constitution modifier.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Equal to 12 + your Constitution modifier.

power.title: Healer's Gift
power.fluff: You tend to a fallen comrade and stave off death's touch

section.name: Target:
section.target: One dying creature adjacent to you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to his or her healing surge value.
If the target has no healing surges remaining, he or she regains hit points equal to one-half his or her healing surge value, and is dazed until the end of his or her next turn instead.
If the target failed one or more death saving throws while it was dying, it counts as having failed one less.

power.title: Iron Resurgence
power.fluff: Though your hands do little to comfort the wounded, you ensure that an injury will not keep an ally out of the battle

section.name: Target:
section.target: you or one ally adjacent to you; The target must be bloodied and have at least two healing surges available

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target spends two healing surges to regain hit points equal to his or her healing surge value. The target can then choose to spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to his or her healing surge value.
The target gains temporary hit points equal to one-half the amount of hit points he or she regained.

power.title: Legend Lore
power.fluff: Legends are your specialty, and you can always find a use for these stories

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make a knowledge check using a skill other than History

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use your History check modifier for the triggering check instead of the original check modifier.

power.title: Perfect Recall
power.fluff: Your mind is a steel trap - nothing escapes it

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You would make an Intelligence check

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use your History check modifier in place of your Intelligence check modifier for the triggering roll.

power.title: Root Understanding
power.fluff: Your studies in history have exposed you to a variety of languages, allowing you to sometimes understand a language in which you aren't fluent

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You see or hear a language you don't understand

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You can understand and speak the triggering language until the end of the encounter.
If the triggering language was written, you can also read and write the language for one hour.
The language skill gained through this power is rudimentary, especially when it comes to rare or exotic languages. Your DM determines whether you can communicate specific concepts or not.

power.title: Strategist's Epiphany
power.fluff: Recalling ancient battles, you find echoes in your enemies' positions and use that knowledge to react accordingly

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You would roll initiative

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use your History check modifier in place of your initiative check modifier for the triggering check.

power.title: Anticipate Maneuvers
power.fluff: You read your opponent like an open book and outsmart it

section.name: Check:
section.text: Insight vs. Passive Bluff

section.name: Success:
section.text: The target grants combat advantage to you for the first attack you make against it before the end of your next turn.

power.title: Calculated Acumen
power.fluff: Your understanding of battle reveals what your enemy tries to avoid

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Choose one enemy you can see that is within 10 squares of you.
You learn the vulnerabilities and other weaknesses of the chosen creature.

power.title: Damning Secret
power.fluff: Picking up on tiny tell-tale signs, you divine a critical weakness in your foe's determination

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make an Intimidate check against a single target that shares a language with you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use your Insight check modifier in place of your Intimidate check modifier for the triggering check.

power.title: Nose for Trouble
power.fluff: You have learned to keep a close eye on your surroundings so that when trouble breaks out, you're ready for it

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You roll initiative and dislike the result

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You reroll the triggering check, using your Streetwise check modifier in place of your initiative check modifier, and can use either result as your roll.

power.title: Bad Guard
power.fluff: You know how to use the threat of violence to play into your ally's diplomacy

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must use this power as part of an interaction where you and an ally are trying to gain information from a creature that shares a language with you.

section.name: Target:
section.target: an ally making an Diplomacy check

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You automatically succeed in aiding the target's skill check, and grant the target an additional +2 power bonus to the check.

power.title: Ominous Threat
power.fluff: You draw your enemy's attention to rest squarely on you

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You hit an enemy with a melee attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You mark the target until the end of your next turn. If the target has marked you or one of your allies, you end the marked condition one one creature.
If the target was already marked by you, you end all marked conditions imposed by it and it is unable to mark until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Mounted Coordination
power.fluff: You synchronize your attack with your mount's movements to maximize your damage

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be mounted on a willing creature.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain a +2 bonus to the first damage roll you make before the start of your next turn. You lose this bonus if you are no longer mounted.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: +4 bonus.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: +6 bonus.

power.title: Nature Instinct
power.fluff: The forest is quiet... too quiet

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You roll initiative in a natural environment

section.name: Target:
section.target: you, and each ally in the burst that can see or hear you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use your Nature check modifier in place of your initiative check modifier for the triggering roll.
You and each target gains a +2 bonus to all defenses until the end of his or her first turn.

power.title: Studied Ritualist
power.fluff: You catch an error at the last moment, correcting a malformed glyph before it can ruin your ritual

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make a skill check to perform a ritual and dislike the result

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You reroll the triggering check with a +2 power bonus to the roll. You must use the second roll.

power.title: Corner of Your Eye
power.fluff: You catch a glimpse of something in the corner of your eye, allowing you to react faster

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You roll initiative

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You roll twice and use either result.

power.title: Far Sight
power.fluff: You focus your senses to pick out enemies at the edge of your vision

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, your ranged attack rolls take no penalty from long range, and ignore cover and concealment (not superior cover or total concealment) at normal range.

power.title: Faith Healing
power.fluff: Your prayers help an ally recover their will to fight

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target can use his or her second wind without spending an action.

power.title: Proper Verse
power.fluff: You quote scripture to add gravitas to your words

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You would make a Diplomacy check or an Intimidate check

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use your Religion check modifier in place of the triggering skill's check modifier.

power.title: Studied Ritualist
power.fluff: You catch an error at the last moment, correcting a malformed glyph before it can ruin your ritual

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make a skill check to perform a ritual and dislike the result

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You reroll the triggering check with a +2 power bonus to the roll. You must use the second roll.

power.title: Elude Senses
power.fluff: You slip past the notice of creatures that have adapted to life underground

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, creatures can't use blindsight or tremorsense to detect you, and you have concealment against creatures relying on darkvision. You can be detected with other senses as normal.

power.title: Obscured Avoidance
power.fluff: Although an enemy's attention is on you, its inability to see you clearly can keep you out of harm's way

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You start your turn and are marked, and have concealment against the marking creature

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The marked condition on you ends.

power.title: City Rat
power.fluff: Like a rat, you are particularly skilled at using the environment, as well as your companions, to stay out of sight

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must have cover against at least one creature.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You make a Stealth check to hide, using your Streetwise check modifier in place of your Stealth check modifier for the check.

power.title: Failed Diplomacy
power.fluff: Negotiations are breaking down and will end in bloodshed - you realize this fact a split-second before your enemies do

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: Initiative is rolled

section.name: Target:
section.target: you, and each ally in the burst

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Each target gains the following two benefits:
+2 power bonus to the triggering Initiative check.
Combat advantage against all enemies that have not yet acted. This lasts until the end of the targets next turn.

power.title: Nose for Trouble
power.fluff: You have learned to keep a close eye on your surroundings so that when trouble breaks out, you're ready for it

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You roll initiative and dislike the result

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You reroll the triggering check, using your Streetwise check modifier in place of your initiative check modifier, and can use either result as your roll.

power.title: Secrets of the City
power.fluff: You learn all the city's secrets by keeping your ear to the streets

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You would use Arcana, History, or Religion to make a knowledge check relating to a settlement that you are familiar with

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use your Streetwise check modifier in place of the triggering skill's modifier for the triggering check.

power.title: Fast Hands
power.fluff: Your fingers blur as you manipulate objects faster than the eye can follow

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You either draw or seathe a weapon, pick up an unattended item in your space or adjacent to it, or retrieve or stow an item.

section.name: Special:
section.text: You can use this power only once per round.

power.title: Lock Tap
power.fluff: A practiced tap is sometimes all it takes to pop open a lock

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You make a Thievery check to open an adjacent lock.

power.title: Quick Palm
power.fluff: Through sleight of hand, you make an object disappear

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You make a Thievery check to either pick an adjacent pocket or to use sleight of hand.
